text: I am a digital hoarder you may have
noticed that I like to take a lot of
pictures on my phone and now I have like
2500 photos on here um
help
help arrived on April 9th as it turns
out cloud storage company Dropbox
announced a new photo management app
called carousel it's free for iOS and
Android and it is super simple to use
especially if you're already a Dropbox
user it organizes all the photos that
you've uploaded to Dropbox from any
device into these little albums by date
then you can share to all the usual
sources but what I really like is that
you can share to individuals and you get
this nice little chat interface and they
can even download the photos that you've
shared there are some big drawbacks
though the chat sharing requires the
other person to download carousel even
if you just want to text a picture and
sharing to Facebook or Twitter also
pushes people to download carousel that
is lame and it feels like spam you also
can't edit pictures or put them in
albums even if they already exist on
Dropbox and Dropbox only gives you 2
gigabytes of free storage which goes
pretty fast
luckily carousel is not the only option
out there Google+ works in a similar way
to carousel in terms of uploading and
organizing photos but sharing is only to
Google Plus and the default is public so
don't thank you also you have to have
the entire Google+ app installed so it's
just not quite as simple in terms of
pure photo management
then there's flavor it doesn't do
backups but it organizes a lot better it
can actually read your calendar so it
can organize photos by date or by event
then you can rename albums and when you
share them people get this fancy page
that plays a slideshow and even video
carousel is definitely my favorite so
far even though it's probably only going
to enable my digital hoarding habit but
you just never know when you're gonna
need a picture of your delicious
breakfast
Oh
